com.arunsoft.commonutils

Class CommonDialogs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arunsoft.commonutils.CommonDialogs

  • public class CommonDialogs
extends java.lang.Object
    Commonly used dialogs

    This class consists of static methods for creating commonly used dialogs with ease. Can be used to create info dialogs, confirmation dialogs and most importantly text input dialog. All Dialogs are created and shown immediately and asynchronously.

      • infoDialog

        public static void infoDialog(@NonNull
                              android.content.Context c,
                              java.lang.String title,
                              @Nullable
                              java.lang.String msg,
                              @Nullable
                              java.lang.String closeText)
        Simple dialog to show information to the user.
        Parameters:
        c - The context for creating dialog
        title - Dialog title
        msg - Message to be shown on the dialog (could be null)
        closeText - Text for the close button (default - close)

      • confirmationDialog

        public static void confirmationDialog(@NonNull
                                      android.content.Context c,
                                      java.lang.String title,
                                      @Nullable
                                      java.lang.String msg,
                                      java.lang.String yesButtonText,
                                      java.lang.String noButtonText,
                                      CommonDialogs.ResponseListener listener)
        Simple dialog with 2 choices. Can be used for confirmation, but it's not limited to this.
        Parameters:
        c - The context for creating dialog
        title - Dialog title
        msg - Message to be shown on the dialog (could be null)
        yesButtonText - Text for positive button
        noButtonText - Text for negative button
        listener - Listener to get callbacks with the user's response

      • confirmationDialog

        public static void confirmationDialog(@NonNull
                                      android.content.Context c,
                                      java.lang.String title,
                                      @Nullable
                                      java.lang.String msg,
                                      CommonDialogs.ResponseListener listener)
        Simple dialog with 2 choices. Can be used for confirmation. It shows a 'Yes' and 'No' button
        Parameters:
        c - The context for creating dialog
        title - Dialog title
        msg - Message to be shown on the dialog (could be null)
        listener - Listener to get callbacks with the user's response

      • inputTextDialog

        public static void inputTextDialog(@NonNull
                                   android.content.Context c,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String msg,
                                   boolean multiLine,
                                   int inputType,
                                   CommonDialogs.TextEnteredListener listener)
        Dialog with an EditText. Can be used to get text input from user such as file names. It isn't restricted to text. By setting the right inputType, it can be used for numbers or password It also supports a validator in callback, which you can use to validate user input.
        Parameters:
        c - The context for creating dialog
        title - Dialog title
        msg - Message to be shown on the dialog (could be null)
        multiLine - Whether or not the user can enter multiline text
        inputType - InputType for the EditText. Should be from InputType{android.text.InputType}
        listener - Listener to get callbacks with user's response

      • inputTextDialog

        public static void inputTextDialog(@NonNull
                                   android.content.Context c,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String msg,
                                   boolean multiLine,
                                   CommonDialogs.TextEnteredListener listener)
        Dialog with an EditText. Can be used to get text input from user such as file names. It also supports a validator in callback, which you can use to validate user input.
        Parameters:
        c - The context for creating dialog
        title - Dialog title
        msg - Message to be shown on the dialog (could be null)
        multiLine - Whether or not the user can enter multiline text
        listener - Listener to get callbacks with user's response

      • singleChoiceListDialog

        public static void singleChoiceListDialog(@NonNull
                                          android.content.Context c,
                                          java.lang.String title,
                                          @Nullable
                                          java.lang.String msg,
                                          java.lang.String[] items,
                                          int selected,
                                          CommonDialogs.ItemSelectedListener listener)
        Dialog that lets user choose 1 option from multiple. It shows radio buttons letting user to choose one.
        Parameters:
        c - The context for creating dialog
        title - Dialog title
        msg - Message to be shown on the dialog (could be null)
        items - The array og the options to display
        selected - The currently selected option. Should be within the range of the items array
        listener - Listener to get callbacks with user's choice
